sentences.en: Don't be so saucy with me!
He was saucy and mischievous when he was working.
sentences.cn: 他工作时总爱调皮捣蛋.

sentences.en: It was saucy of you to contradict your boss.
sentences.cn: 你顶撞你的老板真是没礼貌.

sentences.en: Perhaps I was too saucy and provoking.
sentences.cn: 可能是我太莽撞无礼,咄咄逼人了.

sentences.en: She holds her head high, and probably can be saucy enough where she dare.
sentences.cn: 她趾高气扬, 也许在她敢于放肆的时候,会很放肆的.

sentences.en: She is a saucy little miss!
She was tall , slim, rather swarthy, with large saucy eyes.
sentences.cn: 她瘦高个, 皮肤黝黑, 有一双漂亮的大眼睛.

sentences.en: The office boy got the bird for being saucy to the director.
sentences.cn: 这个勤杂员由于冒犯局长而被解雇了.

sentences.en: The saucy child protruded her tongue.
sentences.cn: 这无礼的孩子伸出了她的舌头.

sentences.en: The saucy little girl from Hartford promptly corrected his idea.
sentences.cn: 活泼爽直的哈特福德姑娘马上修正他的主张.

sentences.en: The teacher didn't like the boy's remarks and told him not to be saucy.
sentences.cn: 老师不喜欢那孩子说的话,告诉他不得无礼.

sentences.en: This rather saucy assumption failed in being offensive.
sentences.cn: 这种颇为轻盈活泼的傲慢并不冒犯任何人.

sentences.en: Tom got the bird for being saucy to the manager.
sentences.cn: 汤姆因为对经理不礼貌而被解雇了.

words.tran_cn: 莽撞地；傲慢地；别致地；调皮地

trans.tran_cn: 粗鲁的，粗俗的，不雅的，开色情玩笑的
trans.tran_en: saucy jokes, remarks etc are about sex in a way that is amusing but not shocking
